content.description:
Figure 1. A signaling cascade triggers the relaxation of smooth muscle cells.

Blood vessels are surrounded by cells called smooth muscle cells. Nitric oxide triggers a signaling cascade in smooth muscle cells that causes the cells to relax (Figure 1).
content.question: Which of the following is represented by the gradual increase in thickness of the arrows from the top to the bottom of Figure 1?

choices.label: The rate at which nitric oxide triggers signaling gradually increases over time.
The number of signaling molecules that are produced or activated increases with each step in the pathway.
The size of the proteins in the pathway increases as the signaling cascade moves through the cell.

The signaling pathway uses an increase in negative feedback to reduce intracellular <math alttext="Ca with a plus 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ca</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> levels and cell sensitivity to <math alttext="Ca with a plus 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ca</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The number of signaling molecules that are produced or activated increases with each step in the pathway.
